reviewText:
This game is A LOT better than it seems. You shouldn't trust your impressions after first few levels. Yes, they are boring, but not representative for the whole. I got the game in the bundle and first played in on tablet - and hated it. I tried it again after a year, when I installed it from steam. I tediously bombed my way through the initial levels, motivated only by getting some steam achievements. And then, suddenly, I was hooked. The levels started to be more demanding, the achievements harder to get - that was it. I needed to be stealth, to plan my route, to study enemies' paths and be quick at that. Overall it took me seven hours to complete the game with all achievements and I quite enjoyed it. And I haven't even touched player-made levels (yet). Definitely worth playing.

Summary:
- shallow and boring at the beginning
- not very appealing artwork
+ gets better after a few levels
+ gets even better when you aim for all achievements
+ lots of player-made levels if you're hooked
voteText: 31 of 34 people (91%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
A quite different top-down stealth game with a fair bit of a challenge. Using your flashlights and bombs you need to fulfill the different requirements of the levels which can be things such as no death, no kills or not using a flashlight. It starts of simple but gets tricker the further in you get and often requires multiple playthroughs of the levels to fully complete each of them.

The achievements are just for completing the different tasks in the game and ends with fully completing the game and all the level requirements.

Time to 100%: 5 hours

reviewText:
Dynamite Jack is a nice, albeit rather short, Bomberman-style game.
Personally, I really enjoyed playing through the campaign: most maps are indeed quite easy, but if you want the experience to be more challenging you can just decide to try and get all the secondary objectives on you first try, instead of coming back to collect them one at a time.
This, opposed to just going for the exit, does make the game more rewarding but doesn't really increase its longevity: you will probably get to 100% completion in about 7-8 hours tops.
Still, for me this wasn't really an issue, better an honest" short title than a game that drags on and on with pointless objectives and impossible achievements.
Also there are many community maps
date: so if you really like the game you can keep playing it even after finishing the campaign.\n\nAs far as the price is concerned
recommended: if you like this kind of game I'd say it's worth it; with a coupon you can even get it for 1€
hoursPlayed:
and that's a steal in my opinion.

PROS
- pleasant design.
- levels last a few minutes
voteText: making this the ideal choice if you don't have much time.\n- getting all the achievements is not an impossible task (quite the opposite
helpfulPercent:
actually).
- really fun if you enjoy this kind of game.

CONS
- some mechanics could (and should) have been exploited more; for example the "spiders" which appear in the last couple of maps in my opinion deserved to appear more throughout the game

reviewText:
I just spend 12 hours completing Dynamite Jack. Have I longed for a game like this in years! The nostalgic going-back-in-time feeling of Commodore64, wow that is not something I come across often.

I bought this game because I received a 75% off ticket to this game I had never even heard of - but it's worth the full price. Absolutely!

God dammit, if you are from an age where you used a joystick, you WILL miss out if you don't give this game and yourself a chance to do what I just did.

reviewText:
Dynamite Jack is a top-down puzzle/stealth game where your character is working through a series of levels attempting to avoid guards' line of sight while getting keys/blowing up obstacles in order to make your way to the exit.

The graphics are clean and the gameplay is simple, but effective. Each level consists of 3 additional goals in a variety of categories (collect certain items, don't kill anyone, kill everyone, etc) which provides some small level of replayability - in some cases, not all three can be achieved in a single playthrough.

The game is fun. Kind of easy, but fun. The only REAL problem I ran into is there were multiple instances where the game did not save progress properly - I beat many levels (in some cases 4 complete worlds") and the save did not get uploaded to Steam Cloud properly (and it did not keep track of it locally)
date: so I ended up having to redo all that progress. It was quite frustrating. However
hoursPlayed: it was a good time.\n\nIt only takes about 5 hours to complete everything there is to do in the game. Consider that when choosing the price you want to purchase at."
votesTotal: 8 of 8 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
The soundtrack is quite good, the gameplay is good and the game is unforgiving ( while going for achievements. ) I had a lot of fun playing through this top-down stealth game.

It took me 5 hours to complete the game and it's definately one of the best stealth game I have ever played. It's really intense and the last levels are quite a challenge! The graphics are nothing too impressive, but the game run well at least. There are 28 levels with 3 secondary goals each and there is no storyline at all. The controls with a keyboard only are responsive and the the game is easy to get into.

If you're a fan of the genre, don't hesitate to purchase this game, it's worth it!

reviewText: Dynamite Jack is a stealth game.  You have the ability to start with or pickup bombs and a flashlight in order to achieve your goal of reaching the end of the level.  In order to reach the end of the level you will need to evade or kill the soldiers protecting the mines you are walking through, collect key cards and/or destroy colored electrical fields.  The graphics are simple, but work very well for this type of game and definitely let you know if you will be seen or not.  The ability to control your character through the levels is very intuitive and fluid.  The difficulty level ramps up as you progress through the mines and special ways of beating each level are offered such as no flashlight, no deaths, or no kills.  I thoroughly enjoyed the game, beat the game and then came back to unlock all achievements.  A very approachable and fun stealth game that you shouldn't miss.

reviewText:
While I admit it has got nice graphics, sound and an interesting gameplay idea, the gameplay itself isn't well enough executed. First of all, those dark creatures are just plain and simple annoying. You need to point your flashlight to them, so they are scared off, but if they get too close it isn't possible to turn around right in time and you will die.
Then, the game heavily relies on trial&error, expect to die a lot. Annoying, just annoying.
And finally, the bomb mechanic makes the game stupidly easy and takes away any stealth elements. Just a place a bomb, detonate, place a bomb right in the same place, run away and as soon as guards come there: Detonate and they're gone. And that's all. Unfortunately some missions even rely on that, else you won't be able to finish it.
I liked the idea of mechanical-spiders not being destroyed by bombs, but unfortunately, only the very last 2-3 maps rely on them.
It is a really great concept, but just not thought out, how about making guards invincible to bombs? Why don't guards disarm bombs if they run over them?

reviewText: Dynamite Jack must blast his way to freedom! Jack, a brave space marine, armed with only bombs and a flashlight, must escape the Anathema Mines! Use stealth to sneak past guards and bombs to obliterate enemies in this intense top-down action-adventure. 28 Thrilling Levels. Each level brings you closer to the surface of the Anathema Mines. Battle your way through guards, scientists, cave trolls, lasers, and robotic spiders!- Build More MapsHave you destroyed and crushed the game? It's time to make MORE GAME! The super simple level editor will empower you to create levels in just minutes! You can share them with your friends and the world!- Play More MapsReady for more? Every map that is shared will be available for you to play! Skim through the most popular levels and have a blast escaping all the user created maps.- Speedrun LeaderboardsEach level in the game has its own speedrun leaderboard for competing with your friends and everyone else! Each community created map also gets its own leaderboard, so you can compete with your friends on the map you just created!\nFeaturing a stylish interface, exciting gameplay, and a pair of control options that work in tandem, Dynamite Jack is a fantastic offering and a joy to play.

reviewText:
This game is really fun. As some reviews say it's a good time waster but time well wasted. It's quick and easy to get into and while the mechanics stay somewhat the same thorughout the game the new maps still provide a needed change in stratagy.

I have only one very big gripe about the game. I have 2.6 hours on record right now and was going to go complete the game. I happened to lose internet one day and when I loaded up Dynamite Jack it started back from the beginning. I thought it's no big deal, it's just a sync issue. Well when I got internet back I still didn't have my save. As far as I can tell I lost all of my progress. I looked for the local save file but I think there lies the problem. It appears that the game just saves to a single 'state.dat' file. So when I couldn't find the cloud version it overwrote it later with the new state I inadvertantly made when I launched the game from offline mode.

Just be careful you know where your save is and to back it up! (%APPDATA%\Dynamite Jack)

Finally I'd say it isn't worth 10 dollars, try to get it on sale when the price is around 5 dollars. But either way it's a solid fun game.

reviewText: Easy puzzle game! Get key for door and go in next room. Create own maps and release them. And then play maps created by others.

A very enjoyable and fast paced (or slow paced - you choose!) 2D action game.

Finishing each level comes easy, but trying to achieve the three milestones for each level proved quite challenging a few times over.

An easy to pick up and play title worth your time.

Dynamite Jacck is an epic huge dungeon-crawler action adventure game where you play as Jack a brave space marine who was captured in battle and was forced to work in the Anathema mines and now he has just broken free so now you must sneak past guards, robot spiders, cave trolls and other dangers to escape the mines. All you have is your trusty flashlight, and an unlimited supply of bombs at your disposal. In excellent 2D graphics this game will be keeping you busy for a while.

I thought this was generally a fun game.  Using just a flashlight and bombs that you have to find in the levels, you've got to make your way past guards and other obstacles to reach the exit.  This involves picking up keys to open locked doors and a lot of sneaking around, timing things just right, to avoid being shot.  Naturally, later levels get harder, but it's not terribly difficult to finish the game; I did in a few hours, but far from perfectly.  There is some reply value though in that it's possible to unlock extra levels if you don't the first time through, and each level normally has three goals/achievements, like beat a certain time or don't use the flashlight at all, so you can try to three star" each level if you want.  It's pretty easy to pick up and put down at will since there's no real story to it
recommended: so if you like puzzles (which I think this basically is)
hoursPlayed: I think it's worth a try."

reviewText:
Dynamite jack is a Dynamite Game in every sense of the word.

The story follows Jack in his attempt to escape from the mines, and you guide him through the caves and avoiding the guards.

The game isn't very hard if you're just trying to rush through, so challenging yourself to beat each levels 'goals' will make it a lot trickier. That said, the game doesn't take an especially long time to complete. This is where the in-built level editor, and comunity maps come in handy. There are plenty of them for you to play, allowing for extended value to the playtime.

The various types of enemy and hazard get progressively more difficult, and there is a wide enough variety that you can discover as you progress.

This game can be controlled via. keyboard or controller. I found that keyboard was easier to control, but both work well.

The graphics in this game are very nice. The maps are well designed to give the feeling that you are trapped in 'caves', even though it's all top-down. The colour accenting isn't too over the top, and the glow given off by various entities is very subtle and adds a lot of depth to the maps.

This game's soundtrack is great.

I found no bugs in this game, it's very well made.

This is a great top-down stealth game, and definitely worth the money.
Funny game
Fun little stealth game. Missions are pretty short, but if you go for the non-violent achievement, they can be pretty tricky and rewarding.
BEST 2D GAME I BOUGHT
Good fun game! Not that long but takes some skill to master. Give it a try!

reviewText: Dynamite Jack feels like a finnish homebrew from the nineties. I wager that this was a game that was made technology first, design later. The story is slapped on, the art direction is nonexistent, the levels are simple and uninteresting and the game introduces pretty much all of its few features in the first couple of levels. I see no reason to recommend nor play Dynamite Jack.

reviewText: Dynamite Jack is a little top-down action stealth title where you have to avoid guards while placing bombs and collecting items like keycards. However, by adding new enemies and new things like barriers and lasers it gets increasingly more difficult. The graphics are simple, and even though it's a bit of a stealthy game, there is more than enough color to be found in the maps. The sound effects are basic but get the job done. It's an enjoyable game, especially for a price this low, but I don't think it's fun enough for long sessions. Still, like I said, enjoyable.\n\n[Rating: 69/100]

reviewText:
The game mechanics are odd such as;

- The guards can spot and kill you when you are in the light even with their backs turned.

- The guards will run towards an explosion from across the map if you are in close proxmity to the explosion, otherwise the guards will ignore the explosion even if they are right next to it.

- You are an escaped miner yet you don't have mining tools, no drill, no pickaxe!

- The acheiment to kill everyone is just pointless and adds no challenge.

This game could have been better but instead feels lackluster and just not very exciting or fun to play.

reviewText:
Pretty cool game. if you liked the old school Dyna/Bomberman/etc. type of game, this takes that to a new level. Blow stuff up, avoid hazards, be quick and careful, win. The campaign isn't bad, but it's quickly over. The community maps provide an endless source of challenges, if you're willing to find the good maps among the tons of bad ones.
The enemies are 100% predictable, in fact they work more like an automated security system rather than enemies. The map editor is easy to use, but it's very limited.
There are collectible thingies on the maps too, which I never cared about.
I got this through a humble bundle, and it was worth it, I've spent a lot of time playing the community maps. Now I'm kinda bored with it, but i still think it's a cool game.

reviewText:
The game plays with a mechanic that is sorely lacking / done right in gaming - stealth, especially using light/dark. you hide from your enemies, who have torches, and then (hopefully) blow them up, andmaybe some walls so that you can escape this nightmare prison that you are in.

If you are in light, you are seen, you are insta-giblets. Stay out of the light.

I didn't like the game. It felt like bomber man, and the graphics, although sufficient, felt lacking... which is understandable for a game built for Ludum Dare (a 2 day programmer competition). I actually felt it was too unforgiving, and too hard. I guess I was after somethign a bit more casual at the time that I tried it. I also hate time-trial based games (with the exception of racing games). This has achievemnts based on how fast levels are completed, although it does not seem to affect the early story progression (I have not completed the game so I don't know about the later levels).

I just didn't enjoy the game, thus my negative.

reviewText:
Everything feels wrong in this game.

First of all, the conext makes no sense at all. You're some sort of futuristic soldier that accidentally lands where he doesn't wanted to and in the end he tries to escape the caves from... people... who I don't really know why they're there... using a flashlight and bombs...?

Secondly, the game is not fun at all. The main idea, which I suppose was trying to make some sort of stealth-like game using lights and shadows throughut the cave, is so heavily squeezed every single level looks just the same to the rest. ALL 28 levels looked the same. Once you've done 3 or 4, you'll know what you'll see until the end.

And the mechanics themselves are just irrational. This game is light/shadow sight-based but nevertheless the guards will never notice the bombs you've just put in their way, even if they're staring to them. The AI is absolute simplistic and lacked of any intelligence. Guards will just follow their own route and maybe notice your detonations, but with 100% predictible moves.

Overall, I can't recommend this game because it's just extremely meh. I'm sure you'll find MANY better indies than this more worthy.

4/10

reviewText: It's a survival game with a dungon crawler base.   The graphics are not really anything to look at, but it's easy to tell where you are and who is an enemy.  Lighting plays a big deal in this as well as well as dynamite.  Well, the dynamite really looks like generic bombs from almost any game that uses bombs.  But it's fun and easy to learn.  Checkpoints make experimenting easy and satinsfying.   Leaderboards make for replayability, but that's nothing I'm interesting in.  No story, but doesn't need one.  It's fun.

Dynamite Jack is a top-down game, where the objective is to avoid the guards so you can ultimately escape the mines. A simple concept, but it works, so can't complain.

This game does wonderful job of create a small cave atmosphere with the level design it provides. Stating that, it doesn't really branch to much other then the cave design. Some levels might have indoor sections yet the floor textures can feel a bit out of place when right next to the cave enviroment.

This intial game is pretty short and there might not be to much cause for replayablitity of the main level, yet it does have some fairly good, and for most part, well designed community Workshop levels.

This is a tough review for me because it was a good game to start out with, but it's not something that really is great in comparision to other indie or triple A games. So at the end I have to say, watch some gameplay videos and if you feel like getting this, possibly think about getting it on sale because, as previously stated, it's not a very long game.
The music is the only cool thing about the game. An OCD impulse is what drove me to buy it when I was bored, and I think it was a waste of the money, to be honest...

Dynamite Jack is like a bad version of Bomberman combined with some boring stealth elements. First of all, you have infinite bombs, but can only place one bomb at a time. Throughout the whole game. How boring is that?

About the stealth elements, basically you just avoid the enemy view cones or use a bomb detonation to lure the enemies to a spot, since the enemy AI is so bad that they literally won't do anything else than run to the location of a detonation, and then do whatever they were doing before. As you can imagine, killing enemies is very easy due to this, but some maps give you an achievement if you don't kill anyone (boooring!).

Later on, there are some more challenging enemies, but they only appear on 3 maps and also have a specific flaw which makes it very easy to outsmart them.

About the soundtrack, it really annoyed me after some time, so yeah, it wasn't very good, except for the final map theme.

The story is also basically non-existent, so the whole game just relies on it's game mechanics, which would be ok for a flash browser game, but not much more. It could have been much better.

All in all, the game isn't really bad, but it's not good either. It's a passable time-killer if you really haven't anything else to do, but you're better off playing better games. Don't waste your time with this.

Btw, it takes about 2-3 hours to beat the whole game. After that (if you really like the game) you can play community maps.
Not a bad game, but a bit too simple for me.  It's an isometric puzzle game where you stay away from enemies while blowing up stuff.  Kind of slow paced with boring puzzles.

Dynamite Jack is a  good game for the retro lovers, the feel of the old 80's and 90's look was great but could have done more to the game play.
one, it could have has bigger landscape as it seemed i was in a small box really and not much to do but to sneak and blow you land.
two, ,more objective to the game, better story based would have been good as i never got what the game was really about.

In all the game was good and a good time passer for one with spare time on their hands or a achiviement hunter that wants easy achiiviements.

7/10

Dynamite Jack, what can I say. It's amazing for it's price, but it just doesn't have the features to be the best.

THE GOOD:

+ Great graphics for a top-down puzzel game (shadows and sorts too).
+ Difficulty is nicely build up from easy levels at the beginning to challenging levels at the end.
+ Aggressive AI.
+ No game-breaking bugs (surprising for the price).

THE BAD:

- Not alot of variety in levels.
- Controls are poorly mapped.
- No story line.

Dynamite Jack gives you alot of bang for your buck. Packed up with some nice features and puzzel elements, this game can get real intense when playing. Especially the later levels are filled with hostile AI and difficult maps. The game features a small but clear user interface. There is no irrelevant information shown other than a somewhat annoying tutorial at the beginning of each level. For the €8.99 price tag you get enough levels to play through and the game is surprisingly free of bugs.

However, as soon as you boot the game, pay attention, an automatic cutscene/loading screen will pop-up showing the only bits of story line you will see throughout the whole game. Also, after a long gaming session some levels might feel familiar to previous levels, only to be stacked up with AI and extra objectives to complete.

One last big complaint towards the game is about the controls. They are so poorly mapped even ArmA III has better default controls. Z for your flashlight (yup, that's right), and control your character with the all familiar Unity control system: ↑ ↓ ← →.

Should I get this game for the full price?
- Yes.
Should I get this game when it's on sale?
- YES YES YES.
A simple action-adventure concept that leads to some clever level design and challenging action. Can you survive the escape?

A simple & short top-down stealth game that starts out relatively simple early on and progressively gets a bit tougher to say the least.

The rebindable controls are extremely basic and the animations anything makes is very minimal but not terrible.

The object of the game is to get from point A to point B one level at a time, from your starting location to the exit." You're free to choose what levels you want to start so should you have unlocked them.

Your only real items are an unlimited supply of remote bombs and a flashlight which aren't always available to you immediately (and very few times not at all which becomes part of the challenge). There are a lot of pitch black areas to traverse through so that's where the flashlight comes in.
The bombs provided have a somewhat short range and are there for killing baddies and destroying specific key objects as well as making paths if the terrain present is at all destructible. Making a long path using bomb explosions however can get very tedious because of how short the blast radius is and the fact that you'll always have to keep your distance when placing a bomb so as not to get yourself killed. There's not a whole lot of need to do this at all.

You die in one hit and the stealth mechanics are very basic; stay out of an enemy's field of vision
date: watch for a pattern made by the enemies to figure out when to move
recommended: make an explosion with a bomb and soldiers available & nearby will check out the noise before going back to their scripted pattern. Not too far into the game the types of enemies will become a bit more unique and diverse. None of those new enemies will be anything like the average soldier for the most part.\n\nI've got a few personal yet very small problems though very irrelevant; I find it a bit bothering that the game's called "Dynamite Jack" and he's using those spherical cartoon bombs. Also
hoursPlayed: the story goes that he used to be a space marine who was captured
helpfulPercent: and escaped yet his methods of getting around are remarkably minimal.\n\nBy stealth game standards there isn't much of a big challenge in this game though there are in-game achievements that sort of encourage each map done specifically like beating a map in under a minute
votesHelpful: don't kill anyone prior to exiting
votesFunny: etc.\n\nIt ain't a bad game though with how short it is I'd just recommend getting it for when it's seriously cheap or rather put a teeny bit of consideration if it pops up in another indie bundle."
